alert.note: Alert for Linn; Miami (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 9:41AM CDT until June 04 at 10:23PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kansas, including the following counties, Johnson KS, Linn KS and Miami. * WHEN...Until 345 PM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 941 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Overland Park, Leawood, Paola, Spring Hill, Osawatomie, Louisburg, La Cygne, Linn Valley, Parker, Fontana, New Lancaster, Beagle, Hillsdale, Wagstaff, Chiles, Bucyrus and Stillwell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
